message:
Update Travis CI build status image in README.md (#1801)

* Link Travis build status image to Travis status page

Instead of linking to the logo image, link to the Travis CI page
for the project, which provides information about the build status.
.

* Show the Travis build status for the default branch

The logo currently displays the build status of the last build from any
branch. Change it to display the last build from from the default branch
(dev).

message: Changed JSON construction as per code review

title: Renamed reportList to mReportList
message: Renamed reportList to mReportList

title: * Dropped saveCurrentReportsToDisk from IDataStorageManager as it is
message:
* Dropped saveCurrentReportsToDisk from IDataStorageManager as it is
  better handled within getFirstBatch().  It's only used to force flush
  in-memory buffers to disk to support a developer option to export the
  log files.
* Renamed DataStorageManager::saveCurrentReportsToDisk to
  DataStorageManager::saveCachedReportsToDisk

title: Remove dead imports
message: Remove dead imports

title: Pushed compression of data for ReportBatch into the ReportBatchBuilder
message: Pushed compression of data for ReportBatch into the ReportBatchBuilder

title: * Got rid of wifiCount, cellCount, reportCount and reportString as member…
message:
* Got rid of wifiCount, cellCount, reportCount and reportString as member variables of ReportBatchBuilder
* Added a single ConcurrentLinkedQueue to keep track of all MLSGeoSubmit objects within ReportBatchBuilder
* Reordered extraction of report batch stats in DataStorageManager to allow finalization of the batch and clearing the batch in one call.
* Dropped ReportBatchBuilder.clear() as it's always used immediately after finalize()
* Renamed finalize() to finalizeAndClear()
* Added a peekBytes method to ReportBatchBuilder so that we can compute pending data to be sent for the QueuedCountsTracker

title: removed temporary ReportBatch variable
message: removed temporary ReportBatch variable

title: * Pushed ReportBatchBuilder::incWifiCount and ReportBatchBuilder::incCellCount…
message:
* Pushed ReportBatchBuilder::incWifiCount and ReportBatchBuilder::incCellCount logic down into ReportBatchBuilder::addReport
* Inlined incWifiCount and incCellCount

title: * Introduced a MLSJSONObject which can compute it's own wifi count, cell count…
message: * Introduced a MLSJSONObject which can compute it's own wifi count, cell count and total radio count.

title: * Initial rename of mCurrentReports to mCachedReportBatches.
message:
* Initial rename of mCurrentReports to mCachedReportBatches.
* Pushed down the reset of wifiCount and cellCount to zero into the ReportBatchBuilder
* changed wifiCount and cellCount in the ReportBatchBuilder to be
* added incr and getter for wifi and cell count methods to RBB

title: * Pulled StorageIsEmptyTracker interface to module level
message:
* Pulled StorageIsEmptyTracker interface to module level
* Organized members in DataStorageManager so that it's clear which members are involved with in-memory and on-disk storage of ReportBatch instances

title: * Pushed isDirEmpty from DataStorageManager down into ReportFileList
message:
* Pushed isDirEmpty from DataStorageManager down into ReportFileList
* Changed IDataStorageManager::insert to accept a JSONObject version of a report instead of a raw string.  We want to convert to a string as late as possible.

title: Merge pull request #1590 from garvankeeley/1579-net-geo-motion-sensor
message:
Merge pull request #1590 from garvankeeley/1579-net-geo-motion-sensor

Use requestLocationUpdates options min time and distance to sense motion

title: Use requestLocationUpdates options min time and distance to sense motion.
message:
Use requestLocationUpdates options min time and distance to sense motion.
I think the bug is that the NetworkLocationChangeDetector sets the
initial location with a GPS location, then compares it to the Network
location.
The last time I tried these options was a year ago, and I was not
getting onLocationChanged when I expected it to (sporadically missing
sending this event), so I have avoided using them.

title: * First patch to reduce dependency on StumblerService::isStopped() by making it private.
message:
* First patch to reduce dependency on StumblerService::isStopped() by making it private.
* This adds 3 new intents to the ScanManager that are broadcast when the state changes to start, stop or paused.
* Those 3 intents are listened to by the MainApp now to keep track of the service state removing a dependency to service.isStopped()

title: Added a test and forced a 'zero' record to be emitted if no sync stats
message:
Added a test and forced a 'zero' record to be emitted if no sync stats
are available so that we can force reset any metrics.  This is
important for things like remoteviews and desktop widgets.

title: reworked synchronization around the collection points in the
message:
reworked synchronization around the collection points in the
ObservedLocationsReceiver and forced the getter to provide a copy of
the list.

title: This adds a testcase to make sure that the TileDownloaderDelegate can properly…
message:
This adds a testcase to make sure that the TileDownloaderDelegate can properly handle an HTTP 598 response which indicates some kind of networking error.
I've removed a scary warning message in TileDownloaderDelegate referenced in #1505 removed a duplicate ClientLog.w message.
HTTPResponse now has an additional constructor that accepts a HTTP Status code and a transmit byte length. This makes construction of statuses like 598 easier to build.
HTTPUtil no longer returns NULL in any case.  You will always get a 404, or a 598 on an error.

title: When the ClientStumblerService is initialized, force a single read of
message:
When the ClientStumblerService is initialized, force a single read of
the sync stats, and broadcast this for the metrics view to update on
startup.
Note that in the app the UI components are initialized before the service.

title: * Fixup bugs where ASU and signalStrength are confused
message:
* Fixup bugs where ASU and signalStrength are confused
* Updated int->float for changes related to switching from
  submit->geosubmit
* Got rid of setNeighboringCellInfo method as we can just use an
  overloaded constructor
* Replaced a System.currentTimeMillis dependency with ISystemClock so
  that tests can instrument time.
* Added null checks around DataStorageManager.getInstance() so that we
  don't NPE if the service hasn't started yet.
* Added test for QueuedCountsTracker when no DataStorageManager exists yet.
* added a cache timing test to the QueuedCountsTracker

title: * Cleaned up merge conflicts with `DataStorageManagerTest`
message:
* Cleaned up merge conflicts with `DataStorageManagerTest`
* Dropped MLSTest entirely.  The verification for the blob being sent
  to MLS is in the StumblerBundleTest class now.
* Removed PII leak that might show up in Fennec
* Clean up imports and MPL licenses
* Got rid of extremely noisy debug logging in MainApp when tests run

title: Legacy sensor: use a rolling average to detect motion
message:
Legacy sensor: use a rolling average to detect motion
Use the rolling average at t1  as a baseline, and when the average exceeds
a theshold relative to the baseline average at t1, then notify movement has
occurred, and update the baseline.
Sounds fancy but it isn't :).

title: Fixed some incorrect synchronization in the DynamicProxy which caused services…
message: Fixed some incorrect synchronization in the DynamicProxy which caused services to not be bound in a thread safe manner.

title: Added an explicit UnittestLogger and DebugLogger so that Log.d calls work in…
message: Added an explicit UnittestLogger and DebugLogger so that Log.d calls work in debug builds on devices.

title: * Reworked JSON serialization for geolocate and geosubmit.
message:
* Reworked JSON serialization for geolocate and geosubmit.
* Added basic tests around JSON serialization.
* Repoint to ichnaea's geolocate and geosubmit methods from search and submit
* Updated ObservationPoint to use new count-free JSON
* Added zero length guards around wifi and cell arrays
* Updated the parsing of the Location object coming back from geolocate

title: 2 performance changes. 1) Remove the calc of the zipped size of in-memory…
message: 2 performance changes. 1) Remove the calc of the zipped size of in-memory stumbles from DataStorageManager, and put it in a new class QueuedCountsTracker, that has a rate-limited (every 2sec) max freq of updating. 2) Change the reporting of uploaded stats from an on-demand query, to a broadcast listener, so this info is sent out only when it changes.

title: Merge pull request #1437 from cascheberg/fix
message:
Merge pull request #1437 from cascheberg/fix

@cascheberg Minor bugfixes

title: minor bugfixes
message: minor bugfixes

title: Reorganize the codebase into a reusable library.
message:
Reorganize the codebase into a reusable library.

Added tests and code to support lazily bound Proxy objects for all
services.  This is required to support static assignment of member
attributes like log instances.

Pulled out all the logic for the logging into a debug logger and a
production logger as we can no longer depend on BuildConfig to switch
loggers at runtime.  The logger must be set explicitly now on
application startup.

Minor tweaks to the ServiceLocator to iron out some edge case
initialisation race conditions.

Updated all log instances to use the new logger service.
Rationalized the makeLogTag calls to always require a class.

title: This fixes a long standing oddity that IHttpUtil was passed in as a
message:
This fixes a long standing oddity that IHttpUtil was passed in as a
reference sometimes, and instantiated raw other times.

Now we just grab it from the ServiceLocator.

The UpdaterTest has been simplified to overload the mock networking
using the ServiceLocator.

Minor changes to ServiceConfig are included so that only strings are
needed to instantiate classes, so that the ServiceConfig class does
not need build time dependencies on any other class.

title: Motion Detect: had an extra wait period for first GPS fix. This logic is
message:
Motion Detect: had an extra wait period for first GPS fix. This logic is
of no value.
.
Remove this extra time window, and just use the existing time window,
called mPrefMotionChangeTimeWindowMs, in this code. The code is
cleaner with one time window (as it now has) instead of 2.

The reason the old code was not good, is that the extra time window to
wait for GPS fix is not any different than the existing motion change
time window, except that it was hard coded to 5 mins.

What would happen is that when scanning was started, and there is no GPS fix,
it would wait 5 mins before the motion detection logic would kick in.
This is confusing to anyone trying to understand the workings
of this code. It should be easy to grok based on the developer setting
(the setting for wait XXX seconds before pausing).

MapLocationListener: wrap requestLocUpdates to catch and ignore exceptions

title: MapLocationListener: wrap requestLocUpdates to catch and ignore exceptions
message:
MapLocationListener: wrap requestLocUpdates to catch and ignore exceptions
Arguably, one can check if particular location providers are available. This is only useful if the code then takes further useful actions based on this info. We have no interest in handling this case beyond not crashing and putting an error in the log. Why is the network provider unavailable anyway? What is the mojo on the device required to reproduce this? I tried airplane mode, restricting geolocation to GPS only.  Neither triggered this.
Issue #1311

title: Fix 1271: NPE getting location service for map
message:
Fix 1271: NPE getting location service for map
Added NPE check and a toast. The app is unusable for anyone in this case, and we don't do strict checking for running the app on devices with missing services that are critical to to the app. So at least they will see a toast before it crashes somewhere else in the code.

title: Save battery on unchanging location.
message:
Save battery on unchanging location.
Uses 2-part detection:
1) DetectUnchangingLocation is used to determine if the user has not
moved in 2 minutes, then the ScanManager pauses (this is a low power
state)
2) When the MotionSensor detects movement (which uses very low power
sensors to do so), start scanning again.

Also worth noting, the notification text changes when paused, and the
map view shows a paused message also.

- MapLocationListener will use the network listener until the GPS
kicks in.

  low battery. (Received by MainApp)

title: * CellScanner no longer tries to obtain context.getApplicationContext() and…
message:
* CellScanner no longer tries to obtain context.getApplicationContext() and instead just hands the existing appContext to the SimpleCellScanner implementation.
* MockSimpleCellScanner hooks the context to grab the next block of fake cell data now.

title: * WifiScanner and WifiManagerProxy have been updated to check the simulation…
message:
* WifiScanner and WifiManagerProxy have been updated to check the simulation preference and inject simulated wifi scans into the intent broadcast system.
* Some renames were done on the contexts to indicate that the expected context is the application context (or wrapped context)

title: * Renamed mContext to mAppContext as it's important to be able to track the…
message:
* Renamed mContext to mAppContext as it's important to be able to track the lifecycle of a context unless it's the application context.
* Changed ScanManager so that mGPSScanner, mWifiScanner and mCellScanner are set to NULL when scanning is stopped.

This is required as start/stop may occur after the simulation flag has changed.

* ScanManager will now wrap the application context with  SimulateStumbleContextWrapper which has all the state information required to run a simulation.

The wrapped context is handed down to the GPSScanner, WifiScanner and CellScanner

title: * Dropped ZoomInTileLooper and ZoomOutTileLooper entirely as they no longer do anything.
message:
* Dropped ZoomInTileLooper and ZoomOutTileLooper entirely as they no longer do anything.
* Added an invalidate() call on MapView::setZoom so that any zoom
  change forces a viewport redraw

Note that this will snap back your zoom level if you haven't zoomed in
by a full level.  This behaviour was less obvious before the patch,
but is happened before as well.  It just happened in 2 steps.  Pinch
zoom with an edge that is not redraw, then on the next redraw, the
zoom level would snap back.

* stop() on the CellScannerImplementation will only unhook the listener if it's non-null and the telephony type is GSM or CDMA.
* ScanManager won't create a CellScanner, or try to start one if no telephony hardware is detected.

message:

Bump android tools gradle plugin to 0.12.+, and use the robolectric-gradle-plugin 0.12.+

title: * ITileSource::getDrawable() now expects byte[] instead of a File object
message:
* ITileSource::getDrawable() now expects byte[] instead of a File object
* added a MERGED_FILE_EXT constant to OSMConstants for the etag/cache-control/bitmap merged tile fileformat
* SerializableTile no longer tries to use UTF-8 encoding for headers and just writes out raw bytes.
* A cache-control header is always saved with current time + 300 seconds on saveFile() invocation.
* SmartFSProvider now uses the merged tile format exclusively and does not use .etag, .cache_control or .tile files
* A successful HTTP 304 conditional GET will update the cache-control header inside the SerializableTile on disk
* BitmapTileSourceBase has been adjusted to load from byteArrays, but will still honour bitmap options

title: Full stack traces only show up in logs if we're in a debug build now.
message: Full stack traces only show up in logs if we're in a debug build now.

title: Spamming log with "tileURLString is empty or null" when the tile source
message:
Spamming log with "tileURLString is empty or null" when the tile source
is set to blank, which is a required state for low res tiles.

and android/build.gradle using 0.10.

title: * Renamed OpenStreetMapTileProviderConstants to OSMConstants
message:
* Renamed OpenStreetMapTileProviderConstants to OSMConstants
* Removed OSMConstants and IFileSystemProvider as interfaces that TileWriter implements
* Deleted IFileSystemProvider as it's only implementation is TileWriter and the interface type is never actually used.

message:

message: Added tests and code to serialize tile to File objects.

title: 1121 - NPE due to calling newMLSPoint with a null point
message:
1121 - NPE due to calling newMLSPoint with a null point
This happens due to 400 errors in requesting MLS point. Which leads to the next question as to *why* we are getting 400 errors here. These should be logged already, so we should investigate.

title: Comment updates to LRUMapTileCache and ExpirableBitmapDrawable
message: Comment updates to LRUMapTileCache and ExpirableBitmapDrawable

title: More GC cleanups when swapping low/high res maps.
message:
More GC cleanups when swapping low/high res maps.

This prevents the swapping over hig/low res maps from consuming
~5MB per switch and fixes the flickering issue with tiles being evicted from LRU.

This should mitigate the memory leak mentioned at the end of
https://github.com/mozilla/MozStumbler/issues/1120

title: This reworks the LRUMapTileCache to use a proper LRU.
message:
This reworks the LRUMapTileCache to use a proper LRU.

The capacity of the underlying LinkedHashMap has been modified to be 2x the requested capacity as there's a mismatch in meanings.

The callers is asking for capacity in terms of tiles, the capacity for a linked hash map is the # of hash buckets available which is a smaller number.

The final effect of this patch is that memory usage is pretty constant @ ~37MB on a Moto G with a 5x5 tile screen, but this adds significant flicker.

The upside is that this finally seems to fix the memory consumption error and no more OOM death.

title: Timer was calling broadcastsync on the timer thread, and in general,
message:
Timer was calling broadcastsync on the timer thread, and in general,
doing a bunch of other thread-unsafe access. Made this thread-safe
through use of a handler. (A handler is on the thread where it is
created).

title: * Changed the initialization of the map to be 300ms delayed as per comments.
message:
* Changed the initialization of the map to be 300ms delayed as per comments.
* added a 5 second connection timeout to HttpUtil
* Added GET support to HttpUtil
* Disable debug logging for release builds
* repointed the AbstractMapOverlay to use BetterTileProvider

title: * moved osmdroid under org.mozilla as we're going to start making pretty…
message:
* moved osmdroid under org.mozilla as we're going to start making pretty invasive non-API compatible changes
 * removed slf4j logger from osmdroid and replace it with the mozilla logger
 * Aggressively prune down the osmdroid codebase to just the parts that are essential so that we can properly test components.
 * Fixed some bad exception logging in HttpUtil::get
 * Discarded the LRUMapTileCache::TileRemovedListener as it's never used
 * Removed < GINGERBREAD support from the LRUMapTileCache::remove method
 * Added some comments to recycling ReusableBitmapDrawable instances - I'm pretty sure we *only* use ReusableBitmapDrawable instances
 * Added more warning level logging to see what's going on with download errors in the TileDownloaderDelegate.
 * Removed useless logging message when the SmartFSProvider fails to load anything.
 * Threading has been simplified now so we don't have separate disk IO threads and network download IO threads.
 * We just have IO threads as networking and caching is tightly coupled together within the SmartFSProvider.
 * All threading is actually handled by an ExecutionService within the MapTileModuleProviderBase
 * Dropped MapTileFilesystemProvider as it's no longer used.
 * Dropped MapTileFileStorageProviderBase and adjusted the class inheritance.
 * All error logging now requires either an exception (possibly null) to be passed in as the last argument.
 * Some error logging events have been demoted to just warnings as no actual error has occurred.
 * Removed unused constants
 * changed noisey log level messages to debug
 * bump the size up of the size of the MapTileCache in the abstract TileProvider by 100 tiles.
 * In debug builds - I've added Map and Cover prefixes to the tile overlays so that you can see which tile are actually being used.
 * The BitmapTileSourceBase will now label tiles based on a BuildConfig parameter
 * Swapped out DefaultApacheHttpClient for HttpUrlConnection when downloading tiles

 * I've disabled the handleTile method in the ZoomInLooper as well as
   the ZoomOutLooper so that they no longer do anything.  This forces
   tiles to load from disk or network instead of trying to rescale
   pre-existing tiles and storing/loading them from an LRU cache which
   may evict tiles.

   I believe the bugs in ZoomInLooper and ZoomOutLooper are causing
   the long standing bug in osmdroid listed here:
   https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/issues/52

title: We decided to delete stumbles on 400 (bad request) errors only, in that
message:
We decided to delete stumbles on 400 (bad request) errors only, in that
in theory other errors, particularly 404 can be temporary and
incorrectly returned by proxies. I am trying to minimize the
possibilities of stumbles being disposed due to complaints about data
disappearing that we have no other possibilities for at this time.

For example, if the map is at zoom level x, show the tiles for x - 4.

few tiles need loading to cover the map area.

title: Android toggle buttons are inconsistent.  The XML attribute you define for a…
message:
Android toggle buttons are inconsistent.  The XML attribute you define for a toggle event is called "onClick", but the event listener should hook into onCheckedChanged().

This should correct the odd swipe vs click events in #980.

title: Reporter/HttpUtil cleanup items for easier testing/debugging
message:
Reporter/HttpUtil cleanup items for easier testing/debugging

Reporter/HttpUtil cleanup
While debugging MLSLocationGetter I ran into a few cleanup issues
- wasSent() doesn't seem to serve a purpose, removed
- changed some Log.e(...) to be more concise as the code I was debugging
was spamming the log when throwing exceptions
- added errorMLSResponse on MLSLocationGetter to clear the state after
an error
- In Reporter.java, I added a check for zero wifi and cell count, it is
hard to repro, it happens when I modify the code for load testing (as I
typically do), but it helps prevent false errors when testing at the
very least.

title: I am seeing horrible performance with drawPath() (which I use to draw
message:
I am seeing horrible performance with drawPath() (which I use to draw
triangles),
with as little as 300 primitives.
Turns out drawPath() is poorly supported:
http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/graphics/hardware-accel.html
Changed code to use just draw rect and circle, and tested with 3000
primitives.
Also, lowered the drawing timeout even further to 30 ms, this only
represents part of the drawing pipeline, there is still raster overlays, so we should be
aggressive about stopping the drawing early.

title: Well, this got rather large.
message:
Well, this got rather large.

Major cleanup of AsyncUploader

* AsyncUploader no longer maintains any state anymore except for a
  single AtomicLong to hold onto the number of bytes uploaded.

* AsyncUploader requires a proper AsyncUploadParam argument when
  invoking execute() now.  This encapsulates the useWifiOnly, an
  upload listener, and the nickname
  and email address

* onPostExecute has been removed as it simply called onUploadComplete
  which is only implemented in the MetricsView, and that only invoked
  updateUIThread().  MetricsView::updateUIThread() is also invoked on
  any upload progress, so those calls have been consolidated.

* AsyncUploader::UploadSettings has been removed entirely, as it was
  just a wrapper around the useWifiOnly boolean.

* Dropped SyncSummary as we were only using it to accumulate the
  total bytes during a single execution of AsyncUploader.

* AsyncUploader::isUploading() has been removed entirely.  AsyncTasks
  can only be used once, having a singleton manage the current
  threaded upload state makes no sense.  This needs to be checked by
  subscribing to the AsyncTask using the AsyncUploaderListener
  interface.

* MetricsView manages it's own atomic isUploading flag which is
  modified when the AsyncUploader updates it's progress.

title: Limit ObservationPointsOverlay drawing to 150 ms
message:
Limit ObservationPointsOverlay drawing to 150 ms

Too many points, and the drawing can cause lag on slower devices.  This
will limit the impact.

Performance testing should be done to determine appropriate values for
the maximum duration, as well as how often to check the time.

message:
Merge pull request #784 from garvankeeley/squash-fennec-changes

Refactor for Fennec Integration

title: See Fennec integration bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1038843
message:
See Fennec integration bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1038843

- Refactored StumblerService, moved bound usage to ClientStumblerService,
this is not used by Fennec.
- Restructure code by thread. Concurrency bugs are the highest-risk, and
the code can be clearly organized by thread so future contributers can
see at a glance where thread divisions are.
- ensure that stumbler service init() happens on the correct thread, in
MozStumbler, this is the main thread, in the Fennec service, this is on
the service's dedicated thread
- remove the use of the blocklists from Fennec.
- changed uploading in fennec mode to only upload after a start intent.
Need to ensure that when foregrounded, Fennec sends this message.

Fennec Work: pull database back-end, replace with pure file-based storage

title: A bug! When iterating the file list to upload, we are also deleting
message:
A bug! When iterating the file list to upload, we are also deleting
files as they are uploaded. Need to store a const copy of this list
before iteration begins.

title: Changes to the db meant the syncstats are now stored in a key-value file. This…
message:
Changes to the db meant the syncstats are now stored in a key-value file. This required changing the GUI.
More importantly, with the Android Sync gone, we aren't getting easy access to upload data volumes, this is now shown in the upload dialog (total KB and queued KB).

title: Uploading now uses a Android alarm service. It runs only when the device is…
message: Uploading now uses a Android alarm service. It runs only when the device is awake, and is scheduled to run only when data is queued.

title: These tests were DB-specific, and required gutting. The ServiceTest does a basic…
message: These tests were DB-specific, and required gutting. The ServiceTest does a basic check of passive stumbling mode. This testing is not adequate, but it is better than nothing.

title: The grand refactor to remove the DB.
message:
The grand refactor to remove the DB.
- Delete ContentResolver(s), Database.java

- DatabaseContract is now DataStorageContract, and has the constants
  used for file storage

- DataStorageManager is the backend, it has an in-memory working buffer
  for collecting reports, and in-memory buffer of reports to be sent,
and a list of files on disk (with about 50 reports per file). Please see the documentation  for the class, it explains this in more detail.

-- After data leaves the in-memory working buffer, it is zipped, this
required some changes to the network code to handle pre-zipped data
(AbstractCommunicator.java)

-- The constructor of DataStorageManager also upgrades the sync stats from the old DB.

- Removing the DB propagates changes to StumblerBundle, StumblerBundleReceiver, Submitter, Reporter.
The logic is unchanged in these classes, just cleanup for the backend.

title: Lint complains about a possible circular reference in this file. Changed
message:
Lint complains about a possible circular reference in this file. Changed
the code to use have the inner class reference the outer using a weak
reference, and the warning is gone

title: Relatively minor commit, moving and renaming.
message:
Relatively minor commit, moving and renaming.
- Moved files
-- ScreenMonitor to client, as this is not used by Fennec, so we don't
want in the service (yet)
--- DefaultCellScanner in the client needed updates to take over
start/stop of ScreenMonitor
--- CellScannerNoWCDMA in the service previous hosted the ScreenMonitor,
removed this usage
-- PersistentIntentService is moved from service to service/utils

- SharedConstants renamed to AppGlobals, and this class gets new
  guiLogInfo/Error util function. (dataStorageManager global is added
here, this class arrives in the next commit)
-- requred minor name change in CellScanner, PassiveServiceReceiver,
MapActivity, WifiScanner, GPSScanner

- Scanner.java renamed and moved to scanners/ScanManager.java. For
  clarity, and I avoid having files in the top level dir

title: Client code now uses same database and sync code as server. The gradual move…
message: Client code now uses same database and sync code as server. The gradual move allowed for greater code stability for MozStumbler releases. This will require another beta release.

title: - Support for moz api key.
message:
- Support for moz api key.
- Set the enabled state of the service based on the Firefox pref sent
- support for storing firefox 'stumbling enabled' state. The trick is here is handling the unknown state, so if the service is started from BOOT, then we need to check the pref on disk.

title: Add PathOverlay to the map, to draw the GPS track
message:
Add PathOverlay to the map, to draw the GPS track

Also, use a consistent color for the GPS dot and track.

Note that post OSMDroid-4.2, PathOverlay is deprecated, and OSMDroid
recommends using Polyline in the OSMBonusPack:

https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/issues/40

title: Merge pull request #659 from garvankeeley/provider-to-client
message:
Merge pull request #659 from garvankeeley/provider-to-client

Provider to client-side only for Fennec Integration

title: Provider is client-side only. There is a new db abstraction layer to provide…
message:
Provider is client-side only. There is a new db abstraction layer to provide this. Content Providers are beneficial for  sharing databases between apps and for the async CursorAdapter interface. Neither are needed on the service side, but the latter is handy on the client side for UI purposes. The bigger problem is requiring a content provider requires a manifest declaration, and in must not conflict, and the app is not designed such that multiple clients can access a common db.
Also, fixed lint warning as I hit upon them. Hopefully if we keep at this we can get from dozens or so, to zero.

title: Passive mode is now functional. Added support throughout the service for this.…
message:
Passive mode is now functional. Added support throughout the service for this. Removed use of sync adapter and preferences xml from service.
Renamed xml files as any 3rd party that wants to use them may find a name conflict, as I did trying to use them in Fennec (they aren't used in Fennec proper, but for personal builds I used them).
Added a unit test for Provider, and a larger functional test for passive stumbling mode. This required some hooks in the internals of the service.

title: Code Cleanup.
message:
Code Cleanup.
-  Removed unused ScannerService.

- Refactored the use of generic intent messaging to specific message
  actions, namespaced to their sending class.

- Cleanup naming conventions for Intent arguments. Added consistency to
using string constants for Intent arguments, rather than mixing strings
and string constants in the same block of code.

- Renamed messages to be clearer about their actions, based on what I
  can see the code is doing, specifically MainActivity ACTION_UNPAUSE_SCANNING

title: clean up imports: alphabetize, remove spaces, remove use of *, remove unused imports
message: clean up imports: alphabetize, remove spaces, remove use of *, remove unused imports

title: Move StumblerBundle processing into its own broadcast receiver.
message: Move StumblerBundle processing into its own broadcast receiver.

title: Store StumbleBundles in the ContentProvider.
message:
Store StumbleBundles in the ContentProvider.

This moves the code that creates a ContentValues object out of the
Reporter and into the MainActivity. When a StumblerBundle is ready,
the library will broadcast it to the MainActivity, which will turn
it into a JSON object and store it into the ContentProvider to be
sent later.

Known bugs/FIXMEs:
- Relying on MainActivity to receive a broadcast is wrong, as the
onStop() method unregisters the activity from all broadcasts. There
should be a separate BroadcastReceiver that registers via the manifest
for this.

- The SyncAdapter still knows about the format of the JSON the server
expects, since it needs to wrap a bunch of (JSON representations of)
StumblerBundles into one wrapper object and an "items" array before
uploading. We should at the very least provide a helper method for
that in the library: StumblerUtils.formatForMLS(StumblerBundle[]).

- The location data goes through some seemingly redundant conversions
before being uploaded. Basically a StumblerBundle reaches MainActivity,
which converts it to JSON, then inserts the individual fields of the
JSON object into the ContentProvider (wifi and cell information are
simply stored as JSON strings), from where the SyncAdapter reads them
and converts back do JSON. It's probably possible to just store a JSON
string in the ContentProvider instead.

title: Format StumblerBundles as MLS json objects.
message:
Format StumblerBundles as MLS json objects.

TODO: integrate this with the ContentProvider.

title: Make StumblerBundle Parcelable.
message: Make StumblerBundle Parcelable.

title: wip Split reporter in two.
message:
wip Split reporter in two.

The current Reporter is responsible for syncing the scanner streams,
and actually formatting and uploading data. The first task will in
the future yield a StumblerBundle, which is broadcast by the library,
so that the application can take care of the second task.

title: Use a dedicated receiver for turn off intents.
message:
Use a dedicated receiver for turn off intents.

This is so that mTurnOffReceiver doesn't leak while the app
is in the background.

title: Remove mLooper from the service.
message:
Remove mLooper from the service.

It looks like the only reason why it was being used was so that
date synchronization could happen in a separate thread. Ever since
we started using a sync adapter, this is no longer a concern.

title: Introduce StumblerService.
message:
Introduce StumblerService.

The StumblerService runs in the application's process and
does not contain the notification / low battery bits.

title: Add quickshuttle_
message:
Add quickshuttle_

Spotted a "Quick Shuttle" bus with complimentary wireless internet access advertised on its side near http://www.openstreetmap.org/node/50751933 (Seattle Premium Outlets) intersection, checked WiGLE stumbler (already running) and saw "quickshuttle_1705" SSID in list.
See http://www.quickcoach.com/schedule.htm for service area.

title: Add Motorola Mobility OUIs to BSSID block list
message:
Add Motorola Mobility OUIs to BSSID block list

Tethering in Motorola phones uses the model number followed by a random number as the SSID (example: "XT1032 1934"), which becomes hard to detect by SSID, so add Motorola Mobility to the OUI list.

title: Remove alarm.
message:
Remove alarm.

This doesn't seem to have any effect on process priority (which
is actually controled by setForeground) or service restart after
being killed (which is controlled by the START_STICKY flag on
service start).

title: Remove mLooper from the service and the handler from the Reporter.
message:
Remove mLooper from the service and the handler from the Reporter.

It looks like the only reason why it was being used was so that
date synchronization could happen in a separate thread. Ever since
we started using a content provider + sync adapter, this is no longer
a concern.

title: SyncAdapter will not delete records on error.
message:
SyncAdapter will not delete records on error.

* Assume all errors from cleanSend() are potentially temporary.
* Do not delete anything while sending.
* cleanSend() will Log.e errors.

title: Fixes to communicator package as suggested by @illarionov
message:
Fixes to communicator package as suggested by @illarionov

* Changing context scope.
* Moving closing cursor and submitter command into finally{}
* Deciding that all IOException` can be temporary (reduces data discarding).
* Cleanup if gzip fails: if gzipping fails, the AbstractCommunicator has to clean up first.

title: Fixes bug introduced in #400, adds button to notification.
message:
Fixes bug introduced in #400, adds button to notification.

PR #400 introduced a sneaky race-condition bug. It would try to destroy scanner service BEFORE all the resources from the "downstream" scanners could be turned off by the Looper. Memory leaks and fatal errors ensure. It would only trigger on a low battery intent when there was no client bound...

* new button to turn off scanning with main activity not-running
* fix to the aforementioned bug

One broadcast receiver can handle both intents.

message:

title: Use http:// instead of https:// Mapbox URL's
message:
Use http:// instead of https:// Mapbox URL's

This speeds up tiles loading and fixes exception of strict mode: 'Explicit termination method 'close' not called'.

title: Set aTileSizePixels to 256
message:
Set aTileSizePixels to 256

This fixes many 'java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Problem decoding into
existing bitmap'.
MapBox returns 256x256 PNG tiles regardless of this parameter.

message:
Remove TileSourceFactory.FIETS_OVERLAY_NL layer

This improves loading speed significantly

title: Added in-flight SSIDs to blocklist
message:
Added in-flight SSIDs to blocklist

Although these two SSIDs are for aircraft, they are still a possible concern as the networks are frequently visible from airport terminals.  The systems are not switched off on landing, even though Gogo's Internet access is only available above 10,000ft.

Abstract CellScanner and create default implementation.

This will allow to create different implementations of CellScanner using capabilities of newers API
(for example, getAllCellInfo() in API level 17), or using some non-standart API (Multimple SIM).
